posts.title: Uhmmaneun Changnyeoda
posts.excerpt: Quote: “My Mother is a Whore” is a dark piece of Korean independent cinema from the multi talented Lee Sang Woo, who wrote, produced, directed and even takes the lead role in the exceptionally grim drama. Complimenting his similarly themed “Father is a Dog”, the film is another bleak family tale, which also stars Lee …

posts._title: Robert Bresson – Les Dames du Bois de Boulogne AKA The Ladies of the Bois de Boulogne (1945)
posts.title: Les Dames du Bois de Boulogne
posts.excerpt: Quote: “Les dames du Bois de Boulogne is a 1945 film directed by Robert Bresson. It is a modern adaptation of a section of Diderot’s Jacques le fataliste (1796), telling the story of a man who is tricked into marrying a former prostitute. The title means “the women of the Bois de Boulogne”, a park …

posts.title: Cry Terror!
posts.excerpt: Plot: A wife, a daughter, a steady job. Yesterday Jim Molner was an ordinary guy. Today he’s a desperate man, frantically trying to save himself and his family, held hostage by a demented terrorist who’s demanding $500,000 not to detonate a bomb he’s planted on a domestic airliner. posts.title: Xingfu Shiguang
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: A man stretching the truth for his own sake soon begins doing the same for someone else, with increasingly complicated results, in this gentle comedy from China. posts.title: Fast Food Nation
posts.excerpt: The plotline follows separate subplots that all coalesce around the meatpacking industry. From the meat company executive sent to investigate charges of shoddy processing, to the processing plant use of illegal immigrant labor, to all the lives that are collaterally touched by each participant in the food chain, the movie examines the entire US ethic …

posts._title: Tom Davenport – Born for Hard Luck (1976)
posts.title: Born for Hard Luck
posts.excerpt: Quote: A rare film for blues buffs. Between the Civil War and World War II, many gifted and restless young black musicians found careers in the traveling patent-medicine shows, a favorite entertainment in the rural and small-town South. posts.title: Aritmiya

posts._title: Gilles Grangier – Maigret voit rouge AKA Maigret Sees Red [+Extras] (1963)
posts.title: Maigret voit rouge
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: “A man is shot dead in the centre of Paris and the witness to the murder finds himself the next target in a vendetta between American gangsters. Inspector Maigret is charged with protecting the witness and resolving the mystery of the killing….” – Films de France
